game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • game.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Game
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class contains everything that makes the game work, such as drawing graphics, checking objects collision and updating objects position.
    See Also:
    JPanel, ActionListener, Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  Game.TAdapter
      This class is used to detect key inputs made by the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      Overridden method from ActionListener, depending on the gameState, it will do different tasks for each tick of the mainTimer.
      private void checkCollisions()
      This method checks if Player or Shooter objects touched any of Obstacle, Powerup or Bullet sprites.
      private void checkTimer()
      This method checks if the levelTime is equal or less then 0, if it is the level ends and the user is moved to Congrats Screen
      private void closeGame()
      This method nullifies all the objects required to run the game, it's used when going back to menu after playing the game.
      private void closeMenu()
      This method nullifies all the object required for menu to function, it's used when starting the game from menu.
      private void drawGame(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method draws all images used while playing the game, such as floor of the level, background, player, shooter, obstacles, lives, danger sign, bullet, powerups, and game timer.
      private void drawGameOverScreen(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method draws game over screen, it's here because the game over screen shows how much time was left till the end of the level and this requires easy access to levelTime variable.
      static int getCoins()
      Static method used to give the value of coins variable to other classes.
      static int getLevelsUnlocked()
      Static method used to give the value of levelsUnlocked variable to other classes.
      static boolean getMusicOption()
      Static method used to give the value of musicOption boolean to other classes.
      static boolean getSoundOption()
      Static method used to give the value of soundOption boolean to other classes.
      static int getWindowHeight()
      Static method used to give the value of windowHeight to other classes.
      static int getWindowWidth()
      Static method used to give the value of windowWidth to other classes.
      private void initGame()
      This method initializes the game for the first time when it's started.
      private void initLives()
      This method is used while creating new game objects to create 3 Heart objects(or 4 if user bought a shield in the shop) and add them do sprites ArrayList
      private void initTimers()
      This method sets levelTime based on level selected by the user and creates random numbers for all random timers.
      private void loadSave()
      This method loads save from the saveFile.txt located in program's folder or creates the new one if there is no saveFile there.
      private void newGame()
      This method creates every object required for the game itself to run, such as pause, congrats and gameover screens, new Player and Shooter objects and also new ArrayList in which all the other sprites will be stored.
      private void newMenu()
      This method creates every object required for the menu to function.
      void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
      Overridden method from JPanel, it's used to paint all images that are on the screen, based on current gameState.
      private void saveGame()
      This method saves progress to saveFile.txt that is located in program's folder
      private void stopTimers()
      This method stops all timers.
      private void timers()
      This method creates new Obstacles, Powerups, Coins, shoots the Bullet at the Player and counts time passed, based on mainTimer.
      private void updateSprites()
      This method is used to update the position of all the sprites and background on the screen and delete them if they are no longer visible.

    • Method Detail

      • initGame

        private void initGame()
        This method initializes the game for the first time when it's started. Other than methods from this class it also uses methods from JPanel and ActionListener. It creates new Game.TAdapter so the game can detect keys pressed by user. Creates new Music and Sound class objects and loads save file. It also starts the mainTimer and creates new Menu.

      • newGame

        private void newGame()
        This method creates every object required for the game itself to run, such as pause, congrats and gameover screens, new Player and Shooter objects and also new ArrayList in which all the other sprites will be stored.

      • newMenu

        private void newMenu()
        This method creates every object required for the menu to function.

      • closeGame

        private void closeGame()
        This method nullifies all the objects required to run the game, it's used when going back to menu after playing the game. It's purpose is to save memory on computer by getting rid of things that are not in use.

      • closeMenu

        private void closeMenu()
        This method nullifies all the object required for menu to function, it's used when starting the game from menu. It's purpose is to save memory on computer by getting rid of things that are not in use.

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Overridden method from JPanel, it's used to paint all images that are on the screen, based on current gameState.
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent
        Parameters:
        g - a parameter provided by internals of the GUI system
        See Also:
        Graphics

      • drawGame

        private void drawGame(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws all images used while playing the game, such as floor of the level, background, player, shooter, obstacles, lives, danger sign, bullet, powerups, and game timer.
        Parameters:
        g - parameter taken from paintComponent method

      • drawGameOverScreen

        private void drawGameOverScreen(java.awt.Graphics g)
        This method draws game over screen, it's here because the game over screen shows how much time was left till the end of the level and this requires easy access to levelTime variable.
        Parameters:
        g - parameter taken from paintComponent method

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Overridden method from ActionListener, depending on the gameState, it will do different tasks for each tick of the mainTimer. It also calls for repainting of the images on the screen.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • updateSprites

        private void updateSprites()
        This method is used to update the position of all the sprites and background on the screen and delete them if they are no longer visible.

      • checkCollisions

        private void checkCollisions()
        This method checks if Player or Shooter objects touched any of Obstacle, Powerup or Bullet sprites. In case Shooter comes into contact with Obstacle, the Obstacle is removed and in case it comes into contact with Player, the game ends. If Player comes into contact with Obstacle or Powerup, appropriate method from Player class will be called and the object will be removed. If Player comes int contact with Bullet, one of the lives will be removed and the Bullet will be removed. Once there is no more lives the game will end.

      • checkTimer

        private void checkTimer()
        This method checks if the levelTime is equal or less then 0, if it is the level ends and the user is moved to Congrats Screen

      • initLives

        private void initLives()
        This method is used while creating new game objects to create 3 Heart objects(or 4 if user bought a shield in the shop) and add them do sprites ArrayList

      • initTimers

        private void initTimers()
        This method sets levelTime based on level selected by the user and creates random numbers for all random timers.

      • timers

        private void timers()
        This method creates new Obstacles, Powerups, Coins, shoots the Bullet at the Player and counts time passed, based on mainTimer.

      • stopTimers

        private void stopTimers()
        This method stops all timers.

      • loadSave

        private void loadSave()
        This method loads save from the saveFile.txt located in program's folder or creates the new one if there is no saveFile there.

      • saveGame

        private void saveGame()
        This method saves progress to saveFile.txt that is located in program's folder
